com.poesys.accounting.db.transaction

Class AbstractTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractDto
      • com.poesys.accounting.db.transaction.AbstractTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITransaction, com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto, com.poesys.db.dto.IObserver, com.poesys.db.dto.ISubject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Transaction

    public abstract class AbstractTransaction
extends com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractDto
implements ITransaction

    A data-access layer data-transfer object for the Transaction. This class is an abstract class that contains AndroMDA generated code; change nothing in this class. Instead, override any methods in the concrete subclass generated in the same package. AndroMDA will overwrite this class each time you run it but will never overwrite the concrete subclass.

    An exchange of value between accounts; the items that correspond to the fiscal year accounts must balance (cancel each other out with respect to debits and credits)

    Stereotypes:

    • Persistent
    • SequenceKey

    Class is read/write: true

    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • balance

        private java.lang.Boolean balance
        Nested property balance

        whether the transaction represents a balance transaction, the transfer of an amount onto the balance sheet; balance transactions do not need to have off-setting debits and credits and are ignored in balance checking for normal transactions

        Added by AddLocalAttributeProperties Class is read/write: true Class is immutable: false Property is read/write: true Property is lazy: false

        Nested property items

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTransaction

        public AbstractTransaction()
        Create an empty Transaction for use in building a new object. The concrete subclass must call this constructor.

      • AbstractTransaction

        public AbstractTransaction(com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey key,
                           java.math.BigInteger transactionId,
                           java.lang.String description,
                           java.sql.Timestamp transactionDate,
                           java.lang.Boolean checked,
                           java.lang.Boolean balance)
        Create a Transaction. The concrete subclass must call this constructor.
        Parameters:
        key - the primary key of the Transaction
        transactionId - primary key attribute
        description - a text describing the nature of the transaction
        transactionDate - the calendar day on which the transaction occurred
        checked - whether the transaction is reconciled and validated
        balance - whether the transaction represents a balance transaction, the transfer of an amount onto the balance sheet; balance transactions do not need to have off-setting debits and credits and are ignored in balance checking for normal transactions

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Read an object from an input stream, de-serializing it. Each generated class must have this private method, which the deserialize method calls through Java reflection on the specific class. The class calls a shared code method to run the readObjectSetters.
        Parameters:
        in - the object input stream
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when a nested object class can't be found
        IOException - when there is an IO problem reading the stream
